input_text:
Job Title: Maintenance Technician II, High Performance Work Team

Location: Orlando, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Unleash YOUR Potential With Us 

As a next-generation public research institute and Forbes-ranked top employer in Florida, we are an inclusive community of thinkers, doers, creators, innovators, healers, and leaders striving to shape the future and solve the world’s most challenging problems. No matter what your role is, when you join Knight Nation, you’ll play an integral role in pushing us forward to become among the most impactful universities in the country. You’ll be met with opportunities to connect and collaborate with uniquely talented faculty, staff, and students across 13 colleges and multiple campuses and regional locations. That means greater challenges to tackle, more meaningful opportunities to grow, and rewarding experiences that go beyond a paycheck. We’re seeking qualified, motivated individuals who will help UCF fulfill its mission in unleashing the potential of every individual, enriching the human experience through inclusion, discovery, and innovation; and propelling broad-based prosperity for the many communities we serve.

Facilities And Business Operations

Facilities and Business Operations is committed to providing service to faculty, staff, students, and the community by creating, maintaining, and protecting the educational environment of the university. We support the goals of UCF by being a leader in providing world-class expertise and service.

The Opportunity

The Maintenance Technician II, High Performance Work Team position provides essential support for the operational maintenance and sanitation of campus buildings to provide a safe, functional, clean, efficient, and attractive living and learning environment. The position is responsible for troubleshooting issues and providing service for and responding to customer and staff requests. Ideal candidates will have basic maintenance repair skills and perform basic housekeeping tasks at this level.

Responsibilities

Perform planned and scheduled preventive maintenance (PM) and PM repairs (PMR).Perform corrective work defined as restoring equipment, or a space, to a proper working condition. Identify, isolate, and resolve non-critical building and equipment issues.Maintain and replace light bulbs, HVAC filters, ceiling tiles, and unclog & service plumbing fixtures.Conduct basic housekeeping tasks, including but not limited to vacuuming floors, cleaning windows, and removal of trash/recyclables.Assist with work performed by central shops, contractors, other zones, and departments, or with events on campus. Complete work orders in a timely manner.

For additional information, please visit https://fs.ucf.edu/

Minimum Qualifications

Completion of an approved apprenticeship program for multiple trades and 3 years of relevant experience; or a high school diploma and 3 years of relevant experience. Or an equivalent combination of education and experience pursuant to Fla. Stat. 112.219(6)

Preferred Qualifications

Flexible for utilization by trade with most urgent requirements.Ability to review and understand blueprints and floor plans; and use various metering devices.Demonstrated knowledge of operation and powered drain-cleaning.Knowledgeable of water and gas shut-off points.Painting knowledge and skills.Ability to communicate in conversational English in order to: work effectively with customers and team members; operate electronic equipment; and comprehend standard safety procedures.Demonstrated capabilities in the following: interpersonal skills, memory, attention to detail, calculation, reading, evaluating, comprehension, and organizing.Demonstrated proficiency using Integrated Work Management System (IWMS).Ability to use chemicals approved by Environmental Health and Safety to perform essential job functions.

Health Assessment Required

UCF policy requires completion and passing of a physical exam for this position.

Additional Application Materials Required

If applicable, please attach the certificate of completion for apprenticeship program with application.

Special Instructions To The Applicants

May be required to participate in respiratory and medical examination training, including the use of respirators.

Position requires a valid Class E driver’s license. The position may involve driving to various locations on and off campus to conduct University business.

If you are selected as the final candidate for an employment opportunity, both your position and salary will be significantly based upon the information that you have provided in your application for employment. We urge you to please take the time to complete the application in its entirety.

Classification Title: Maintenance Technician II

This is a repost position. Previous applicants are still being considered and do not need to reapply.

Are Benefits Important to You? 

Working At UCF Has Its Perks! In Addition To Helping Drive Change And Having a Positive Impact By Supporting Our Students, Staff, And Faculty, UCF Offers

Benefit packages, including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Flexible Spending, and Employee Assistance Program Paid time off, including annual and sick leave and paid holidays Retirement savings optionsEmployee discounts, including tickets to many Orlando attractions Education assistance Flexible work environment And more…For more benefits information, go to the UCF Employee Benefits page click here. 

Who Are We? 

Founded in 1963 to fuel the region’s talent pipeline and support the growing U.S. space program, UCF is built to make a better future for our students and society. It’s one of the reasons U.S. News & World Report ranks UCF among the nation’s top 20 most innovative colleges, while Forbes, Kiplinger, and The Princeton Review rank us a best-value university. UCF is one of 14 universities nationwide designated as both a Hispanic-Serving Institution and a Research 1 university. With 13 colleges, including a fully accredited College of Medicine, UCF offers more than 220-degree programs between its main campus, downtown campus, hospitality campus, academic health sciences campus, and 11 UCF Connect centers located throughout the region. In addition, UCF extends its reach to communities in and beyond Central Florida by offering complete, online programs leading to bachelor's degrees, master's degrees, Ph.D.'s., certificates, and more.

Unless explicitly stated on the job posting, it is UCF’s expectation that an employee of UCF will reside in Florida as of the date the employment begins.

Department

Facilities Operations Maintence Team One (F&S)

Work Schedule

Monday – Friday, 4:00am to 12:30pm

Type of Appointment

Regular

Expected Salary

$17.64 to $18.00

Job Posting End Date

05-03-2024-12-00-AM

Veteran’s Preference

Preference will be given to eligible veterans and their eligible spouses in accordance with Chapter 295 of the Florida Statutes. Applicants claiming preference are responsible for providing required documentation by the closing date of the position. For more information on Veterans’ Preference, please visit http://hr.ucf.edu/files/VeteransPreference.pdf

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

The University of Central Florida is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer including Disabled/Vets. Click on UCF's Equal Opportunity Statement to view the President’s Statement.

The UCF affirmative action plans for qualified individuals with disabilities and protected Veterans are available for inspection in the Office of Institutional Equity, Monday through Friday, from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., upon request.

As a Florida public university, UCF makes all application materials and selection procedures available to the public upon request.

The University of Central Florida is proud to be a smoke-free campus and an E-Verify employer.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.title: Maintenance Technician II, High Performance Work Team
output_json.summary: A Maintenance Technician II position at UCF, providing essential support for operational maintenance and sanitation of campus buildings.
job_responsibilities: Perform planned and scheduled preventive maintenance (PM) and PM repairs.
Perform corrective work to restore equipment or space to proper working condition.
Identify, isolate, and resolve non-critical building and equipment issues.
Maintain and replace light bulbs, HVAC filters, ceiling tiles, and unclog & service plumbing fixtures.
Conduct basic housekeeping tasks such as vacuuming floors, cleaning windows, and removal of trash/recyclables.
Assist with work performed by central shops, contractors, other zones, and departments, or with events on campus.
Complete work orders in a timely manner.
benefits: Comprehensive benefit packages including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Flexible Spending, and Employee Assistance Program.
Paid time off, including annual and sick leave and paid holidays.
Employee discounts including tickets to many Orlando attractions.
output_json.company_information: University of Central Florida (UCF), a Forbes-ranked top employer in Florida, is a public research institute focused on innovation, inclusion, and solving global challenges. With over 13 colleges and multiple campuses, UCF offers a wide range of degree programs and is recognized for its contributions to higher education.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: UCF is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer including disabled/vets, committed to diversity and inclusion.

Certificate of completion for apprenticeship program should be attached if applicable.
May be required to participate in respiratory and medical examination training, including the use of respirators. Position requires a valid Class E driver’s license.
Visit the UCF Employee Benefits page for more details.
Eligible veterans and their eligible spouses may receive preference in the hiring process.
UCF is committed to equal opportunity and affirmative action policies.
Affirmative action plans for qualified individuals with disabilities and protected Veterans are available upon request.
All application materials and selection procedures are made available to the public upon request.
UCF is a smoke-free campus and an E-Verify employer.
